snippet: Two mentally disabled half brothers who were convicted in the rape and murder of an 11-year-old girl 30 years ago were declared innocent and ordered released by a judge.
abstract: Henry Lee McCollum and Leon Brown, two mentally disabled half brothers are declared innocent and ordered released, thirty years after their convictions for rape and murder of 11-year-old girl in rural North Carolina; DNA evidence implicated another man; exoneration ends decades of legal and political battles over case that became notorious in North Carolina and received nationwide attention.

byline.original: By JONATHAN M. KATZ and ERIK ECKHOLM
byline.contributor: Jonathan M. Katz reported from Lumberton, and Erik Eckholm from New York.

lead_paragraph: Two mentally disabled half brothers who were convicted in the rape and murder of an 11-year-old girl 30 years ago were declared innocent and ordered released by a judge.

headline.main: DNA Evidence Clears Two Men in 1983 Murder
headline.print_headline: DNA Evidence Clears Two Men in 1983 Murder
